question: <image 1> What is the substance present on the top surface of these citrus leaves?
options: ['Algae', "Don't know and I don't want to guess", 'Honey dew', 'Gummosis-produced resin', 'Bacterial ooze']
description: The image shows a close-up view of several green citrus leaves. The leaves have a glossy appearance with small droplets of a sticky, translucent substance scattered across their surfaces. The substance appears to be evenly distributed and has a slightly shiny texture, reflecting light in certain areas. The leaves themselves are healthy-looking, with no visible signs of damage or disease. The background consists of more green foliage, indicating that the leaves are part of a larger plant.
